short_summary: this is a request for proposals (RFP) against Supply Arrangement (SA) E0225-150564 for Mechanical Engineering Services.
description: Mechanical Engineering Consultant Services to develop plans and specifications describing replacement of the existing dust collector in the Vulcan building woodworking shop at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography.
full_summary:
=====================================================

**Tender Announcement: E0225-240613 - Vulcan Dust Collector Replacement**

*Reference Number: WS4201987312-Doc4202012316*

**Procurement Status:** Expiré

**Publication Date:** September 7, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** September 14, 2023 at 14:00:00

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO), invites tenders for the delivery of Mechanical Engineering Consultant Services for the replacement of the existing dust collector in the Vulcan building woodworking shop at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography.

**Description:**
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is seeking a consultant for the development of plans and specifications for the replacement of the Vulcan dust collector. This project falls within the mechanical engineering procurement category under the Supply Arrangement (SA) E0225-150564 for Mechanical Engineering Services.

**Bidder Selection Criteria:** 

The Contractor is required to evaluate bids on the basis of the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Regions of Opportunity:**

This procurement is restricted to businesses in the province of Nova Scotia that are invited to participate.

**Regions of Delivery:**

The work must be performed in Nova Scotia.

**Contract Period:**

The expected contract start date is September 29, 2023, and the expected contract end date is September 30, 2026.

**Invited Companies:**

* Dumac Energy Limited, 
* Fundy Engineering & Consulting Ltd, 
* AECOM Canada Ltd.

**Bid Submission:**

Please refer to the sollicitation document for full details.

**Debriefing:**

Successful bidders may request a debriefing on the bid results; this should be done within 15 working days of notification.

Full details are available in the sollicitation document. To view, please click [insert link].

**Contact:**

Ms. (Candidates should acknowledge that service work assessed concise locales use, D.J background-objective synonyms regarding.)

```
Grant, Stewart (SPAC/PSPC) 
stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
```
